alert.note: Alert for Alamosa Vicinity, Central San Luis Valley Below 8500 Ft; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft; Southern San Luis Valley; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Between 7500 and 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 6:15PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Scattered strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Alamosa, southeastern Rio Grande, central Costilla and northeastern Conejos Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 614 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along portions of southern Alamosa, southeastern Rio Grande, central Costilla and northeastern Conejos Counties. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 40 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Blanca around 620 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Fort Garland, southern Spring Burn Scar south of Highway 160 in Costilla county and Alamosa East. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
